pullRequest.body:
This is a step towards a concrete category redesign, as outlined in this Zulip post: https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/channel/287929-mathlib4/topic/Concrete.20category.20class.20redesign/near/493903980

This PR updates the category definitions of `TopCat` and some of its descendants to match the new `ConcreteCategory` style:

* Package objects and homs into structures.
* Replace `HasForget` with `ConcreteCategory`.
* Set up a good @[simp] set.
* Ensure constructors and projections are reducible.

I found many places where proofs could be cleaned up, even without looking particularly hard. üéâ Once all the concrete category instances are in we can get rid of even more workarounds.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

| Mathlib.Geometry.RingedSpace.PresheafedSpace.HasColimits | 897 | 898 | +1 (+0.11%) |

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

`+ instance : Category TopCat`

`+ instance : CoeSort AlexDisc (Type _)`
`+ instance : CommRing (X ‚ü∂ (forget‚ÇÇ TopCommRingCat TopCat).obj R)`
`+ instance : ConcreteCategory FinTopCat (C(¬∑, ¬∑))`
`+ instance : ConcreteCategory ProfiniteGrp (fun X Y => ContinuousMonoidHom X Y)`
`+ instance : ConcreteCategory.{u} DeltaGenerated.{u} (C(¬∑, ¬∑))`
`+ instance : ConcreteCategory.{u} Sequential.{u} (C(¬∑, ¬∑))`
`+ instance : ConcreteCategory.{u} TopCat (fun X Y => C(X, Y))`
`+ instance : ConcreteCategory.{w} CompactlyGenerated.{u, w} (C(¬∑, ¬∑))`
`+ instance : IntCast (X ‚ü∂ (forget‚ÇÇ TopCommRingCat TopCat).obj R)`
`+ instance : Mul (X ‚ü∂ (forget‚ÇÇ TopCommRingCat TopCat).obj R)`
`+ instance : NatCast (X ‚ü∂ (forget‚ÇÇ TopCommRingCat TopCat).obj R)`
`+ instance : Neg (X ‚ü∂ (forget‚ÇÇ TopCommRingCat TopCat).obj R)`
`+ instance : One (X ‚ü∂ (forget‚ÇÇ TopCommRingCat TopCat).obj R)`
`+ instance : Pow (X ‚ü∂ (forget‚ÇÇ TopCommRingCat TopCat).obj R) ‚Ñï`
`+ instance : SMul ‚Ñï (X ‚ü∂ (forget‚ÇÇ TopCommRingCat TopCat).obj R)`
`+ instance : SMul ‚Ñ§ (X ‚ü∂ (forget‚ÇÇ TopCommRingCat TopCat).obj R)`
`+ instance : Sub (X ‚ü∂ (forget‚ÇÇ TopCommRingCat TopCat).obj R)`

`+ ofHom_hom`
`+ of_carrier`

`++ hom_ofHom`
`++ ofHom_comp`
`++ ofHom_id`
`+++ ofHom`
`++++++------ of`
`++-- toTopCatMap`
`+-+- coe_of`
`+-+- topCatAdjunctionCounit`
`+--- hasForget`
`- AlexandrovDiscreteSpace`
`- as_coe`
`- bundledHom`
`- instAlexandrovDiscrete`
`- instCoeSort`
`- instContinuousMapClass`
`- instFunLike`
`- instHasForget`
`- instTopologicalSpace`
`- instance (X : FinTopCat) : Fintype ((forget FinTopCat).obj X)`
`- instance (X : FinTopCat) : TopologicalSpace ((forget FinTopCat).obj X)`
`- instance (X : TopCat.{v}·µí·µñ) (R : TopCommRingCat.{v}) :`
`- instance : BundledHom.ParentProjection @AlexandrovDiscreteSpace.toTopologicalSpace := ‚ü®‚ü©`
`- instance : CoeSort TopCat Type*`
`- instance : HasForget FinTopCat`
`- instance : HasForget ProfiniteGrp`
`- instance : HasForget.{u} DeltaGenerated.{u}`
`- instance : HasForget.{u} Sequential.{u}`
`- instance : HasForget.{w} CompactlyGenerated.{u, w}`
`- topologicalSpaceUnbundled`
`- topologicalSpace_coe`
`- topologicalSpace_forget`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>Decrease in tech debt: (relative, absolute) = (17.20, 0.02)</summary>

|Current number|Change|Type|
|-:|:-:|:-|
|4232|-36|porting notes|
|1397|-11|erw|

Current commit [7f1eb1b76a](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/commit/7f1eb1b76a35a1cf33b0cb4f109d153aa0527037)
Reference commit [9aaa799c99](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/commit/9aaa799c99fedd4c376d4c5ca889dbbd3d678b45)

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>
@Thmoas-Guan, you'll be happy to know your ProfiniteGrp only needed some very small cleanups!

pullRequest.title: feat(Topology/Category): concrete category refactor for topological spaces
